newsitem.title: USA: Ill. Gov vetoes taking $35 mln from roads.
newsitem.headline: Ill. Gov vetoes taking $35 mln from roads.

text.p: Illinois Gov. Jim Edgar has vetoed a bill that would have taken $35 million of state road repair funds over five years to help pay for new license plates.

Edgar vetoed the plan Thursday, noting that without new revenues, Illinois will fall far short of funding needed to maintain the 17,000 miles of roadways overseen by the state transportation department.

"This diversion of dollars from the road fund comes at a time when existing state revenues for transportation cannot adequately address the state's need to maintain our roads, bridges and transit systems," Edgar said.
In June, Transportation Secretary Kirk Brown estimated Illinois will fall more than $2 billion short of funding needs over the next five years without new revenues.
Illinois can maintain debt service payments on outstanding bonds issued over the last seven years, but cannot proceed with new projects under the current financial climate, Brown said at the time.
